basics.name: Anirudh Kannan
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: First year undergraduate student at Univeristy of California, Los Angeles. Interested in the field of robotics and computer vision.

experience.name: Arisaka Lab at UCLA
experience.summary: Research about artificial NNs and disparities with human brain, optimize microscope-camera systems with VR

experience.name: San Diego Supercomputer Center at UCSD
summary: Design MLP neural network for 93% accuracy in classifying peptides by cargo using CPPSite 2.0
Utilize TensorFlow to visualize and interpret machine learning curves, Weka for data fitting and cleaning
Meta-analysis, systematic review of 30 papers on Guillain Barre Syndrome, communicate findings to symposium

extracurricular.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
